channel.title: Austin Hellenic Radio
channel.description: Interviews with notable personalities from the Greek and Greek-American communities, as featured on Austin Hellenic Radio.
channel.copyright: All podcasts are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivs 3.0 Unported License.
channel.itunes:summary: Interviews with notable personalities from the Greek and Greek-American communities, as featured on Austin Hellenic Radio.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Hellenic Voices Interview Series
channel.itunes:author: Austin Hellenic Radio

item.title: Interview with actress and filmmaker Katerina Moutsatsou
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Greek-American actress and filmmaker Katerina Moutsatsou, whose recent video, "I Am Hellene," earned tremendous popularity on YouTube. Katerina discusses the video and responds to the controversy it generated. Aired May 10, 2012.
item.itunes:summary: An interview with Greek-American actress and filmmaker Katerina Moutsatsou, whose recent video, "I Am Hellene," earned tremendous popularity on YouTube. Katerina discusses the video and responds to the controversy it generated. Aired May 10, 2012.

item.title: Interview with Peter Stamatis, author of "Dandelions for Dinner"
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Greek-American author Peter Stamatis, who reccently published his first book, "Dandelions for Dinner," on his fathers' experiences and recollections from wartime Greece. Aired May 10, 2012.

item.title: Interview with George Miadis of Sonar Lights
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with George Miadis of the Fort Worth, TX-based band "Sonar Lights," including three songs off of the band's new album, "Here We Are," plus a discussion of the band's recent West Coast tour. Aired May 3, 2012.
item.itunes:summary: An interview with George Miadis of the Fort Worth, TX-based band "Sonar Lights," including three songs off of the band's new album, "Here We Are," plus a discussion of the band's recent West Coast tour. Aired May 3, 2012.

item.title: Interview with poet and activist Stavroula Harissis
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Greek-American poet and activist Stavroula Harissis, on the Occupy Wall Street movement, the current situation in Greece, and on her poetry and writing. Includes a recital of her poem, "Revolution in Progress." Aired May 3, 2012.
item.itunes:summary: An interview with Greek-American poet and activist Stavroula Harissis, on the Occupy Wall Street movement, the current situation in Greece, and on her poetry and writing. Includes a recital of her poem, "Revolution in Progress." Aired May 3, 2012.

item.title: Interview with Matthew Teodori, organizer of the Perspective:Xenakis festival
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Matthew Teodori, the organizer of the Perspective:Xenakis music festival in Austin, Texas, which is dedicated to the musical compositions of Greek-born composer Iannis Xenakis. Aired April 26, 2012.

item.title: Interview with economist Costas Lapavitsas
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with University of London professor and economist Costas Lapavitsas, with the latest on the economic situation in Greece, the failure of austerity and the Euro, and his outlook on the upcoming Greek elections. Aired April 26, 2012.
